title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation.

· As the gas cools, the average kinetic energy (speed) of the O 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4tamaaBa aaleaacaaIYaaabeaaaaa@37B1@ molecules decreases. The molecules rebound with less energy when they collide with each other and the walls of the container. The spacing between particles decreases, causing the volume occupied by the gas to decrease.

OR

· As the gas cools, the average kinetic energy (speed) of the O 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4tamaaBa aaleaacaaIYaaabeaaaaa@37B1@ molecules decreases. The molecules rebound with less energy when they collide with each other and the walls of the container. The only way for the molecules to maintain a constant rate of collisions with the walls of the container (maintaining a pressure of 1.00 atm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGymaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaGimaiaaysW7caqGHbGaaeiDaiaab2gaaaa@3D30@ ) is for the volume of the gas to decrease.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation.

· The ideal gas law assumes that gas particles do not experience interparticle attractions. As a real gas cools further, the intermolecular forces have greater effect as the average speed of the molecules decreases, resulting in inelastic collisions. To maintain a gas pressure of 1.00 atm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGymaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaGimaiaaysW7caqGHbGaaeiDaiaab2gaaaa@3D30@ , the volume must decrease to accommodate more collisions with less energy.

The response provides a valid explanation.

· The ideal gas law assumes that gas particles do not experience interparticle attractions. As a real gas cools further, the intermolecular forces have greater effect as the average speed of the molecules decreases, resulting in inelastic collisions. To maintain a gas pressure of 1.00 atm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGymaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaGimaiaaysW7caqGHbGaaeiDaiaab2gaaaa@3D30@ , the volume must decrease to accommodate more collisions with less energy.
